item.title: Re: Why collect so much before your loop?
item.content:encoded:
The only reason to switch bloodlines (other than wanting different experiences) is because the impossible mission (which is unlocked by having Billy Lvl. 3 and Emosuke Lvl. 3) requires you to hit Sannin with all three. But the impossible mission literally is impossible, no one can do it yet.

If I remember right, it requires: Reaper Lvl. 3 (not in the game yet), Trade Lvl. 3, Sannin with all 3 bloodlines, Leader of an Epic Village with 50 people, Sealed Sand Demon and Sealed Nine Tails, plus Billy and Emosuke Lvl. 3. No one knows what it's for.

item.title: Re: Why collect so much before your loop?
item.content:encoded:
There's a FAQ in the Looping Guide. But you don't lose all your gear, you keep quite a bit of it (anything you won from the prize wheel, anything from the arena, your reaper items, your referral items, etc). You do lose your allies, but you gain themes that make it easier to get them back and you get access to new allies and new level 2 versions of your existing allies. Also, some quests are only available in Season 2+.

(Regarding allies specifically, if you get 45 allies, it unlocks a new theme which you otherwise wouldn't get).

It's mainly a design point. This way, the game is designed with a clear beginning and an end, but it has high replayability, since you get access to different things with each time you play through, and your character does continue to get more powerful with each loop.
